meanings.definition: Having an extreme or irrational fear of heights.
meanings.sent1: She felt acrophobic when she looked down from the tall building.
meanings.sent2: The acrophobic individual avoided going near the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The acrophobic cat refused to climb to the top of the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: His acrophobic mind couldn't fathom standing on the balcony of the skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The acrophobic sensation overwhelmed her as she peered over the railing.

meanings.definition: A person who has an extreme or irrational fear of heights.
meanings.sent1: The acrophobic often chose to stay on lower floors of the hotel.
meanings.sent2: An acrophobic like him finds it challenging to enjoy scenic mountain views.
meanings.sent3: The acrophobic joked about taking up skydiving as a new hobby.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an acrophobic bird afraid to leave the safety of its nest.
meanings.sent5: The acrophobic's heart raced as they approached the glass-bottomed bridge.
